newsitem.title: TUNISIA: Tunisian leasing firm ATL to be floated on bourse.
newsitem.headline: Tunisian leasing firm ATL to be floated on bourse.

text.p: Tunisian Lease (ATL) announced that it plans to float its shares on the Tunis Stock Exchange.
The firm, a subsidiary of Arab Tunisian Bank, would offer to the public 10 percent of its capital after it completes raising it from eight to 10 million dinars, a statement received on Monday said.
ATB also plans bond issues totalling 10 million dinars, details of which will be decided later, an ATL statement added.
It said its net profits for 1996 amounted to 1.81 million dinars and it would distribute a five percent statutory dividend and a six percent super dividend for the 1996 results.
